title: 3D Digital Marketing Website with Shopping Functionality - Frontend Implementation

requirements.summary: Implement 3D interactive homepage with ultra-realistic rendering using React Three Fiber
acceptanceCriteria: 3D scene renders with realistic lighting and shadows
Camera movements are smooth and responsive to user interaction
Scene includes interactive 3D elements that respond to mouse hover and click

file_operations.description: Create main 3D scene component using React Three Fiber (@react-three/fiber, @react-three/drei) with ultra-realistic rendering including PBR materials, HDR environment maps, realistic lighting with shadows (directional, ambient, point lights), and smooth camera controls with orbital and animated transitions. Include interactive 3D elements that respond to mouse hover and click events. Reference the generated hero background image at frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png for textures or environment inspiration.

Create 3D hero section component that uses Scene3D and integrates the generated hero background image from frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png as a textured plane or environment backdrop. Implement smooth camera animations that introduce the scene and highlight key 3D elements.

Create home page component that renders Hero3D as the main interactive 3D section. Include sections for featured services using icons from frontend/public/assets/generated/services-icons.dim_800x400.png and featured products using frontend/public/assets/generated/featured-banner.dim_1200x600.png as static assets.

Wire the Home page component into the app router, setting it as the root route ('/') and ensuring the Canvas from React Three Fiber is properly initialized with appropriate settings for performance and visual quality.

Add global styles that support the 3D canvas rendering, including full viewport height for immersive scenes, and ensure the color palette of deep teals, warm golds, and charcoal grays is defined as CSS custom properties for consistent theming throughout the application.

requirements.summary: Create product catalog with browsing, filtering, and search capabilities
acceptanceCriteria: Products can be displayed in a grid or list view
Users can filter products by category, price range, and other attributes
Search functionality returns relevant results
Product details include images, descriptions, and pricing

file_operations.description: Create React Query hook to fetch products from backend using the searchProducts method from backend interface. Support caching, automatic refetching, and loading/error states.
Create React Query hook to fetch a single product by ID using the getProduct method from backend interface. Handle null responses appropriately.
Create product card component displaying product image, name, description, price, and category. Use shadcn/ui Card component for consistent styling. Include add-to-cart button.
Create product grid component that displays products in a responsive grid layout using Tailwind CSS. Support both grid and list view modes.
Create filter component with controls for category selection, price range sliders, and other product attributes. Use shadcn/ui form components (Select, Slider) for consistent UI.
Create search input component that calls the searchProducts backend method with the search term. Use shadcn/ui Input component with search icon and debouncing for performance.

Create products page that combines ProductSearch, ProductFilters, and ProductGrid components. Manage filter and search state, and pass filtered/searched results to the grid. Implement client-side filtering for categories and price ranges after fetching all products.

Create product detail page that fetches a single product using useProduct hook and displays comprehensive product information including large image, full description, price, category, and add-to-cart functionality.
Wire the Products page at route '/products' and ProductDetail page at route '/products/:id' into the app router.

requirements.summary: Build shopping cart system with add, update quantity, and remove capabilities
acceptanceCriteria: Users can add products to cart with specified quantities
Cart displays all added items with prices and subtotals
Users can update quantities or remove items from cart
Cart total is calculated correctly including all items

file_operations.description: Create React Query hook to manage cart state using the addToCart backend method. Implement optimistic updates for adding items, updating quantities, and removing items. Store cart items in React Query cache and calculate totals on the frontend based on product prices.
Create cart item component displaying product name, image, price, quantity controls (increment/decrement buttons), subtotal, and remove button. Use shadcn/ui Button components.
Create cart summary component showing subtotal, any applicable fees, and grand total. Use shadcn/ui Card component for styling.
Create cart drawer/sidebar component using shadcn/ui Sheet component that displays all cart items using CartItem components and CartSummary. Include checkout button that navigates to checkout page.
Create reusable add-to-cart button component that calls the useCart hook to add items. Show loading state during addition and success feedback. Use shadcn/ui Button with appropriate styling.

Create navigation component with cart icon badge showing item count and triggering CartDrawer. Include links to Home and Products pages. Style with the deep teal, warm gold, and charcoal gray color palette.
Wire the Navigation component into the main app layout so it appears on all pages. Ensure CartDrawer is accessible from the navigation.

requirements.summary: Create checkout flow with order summary, customer information collection, and order confirmation
acceptanceCriteria: Checkout displays complete order summary with itemized list and total
Form collects necessary customer information (name, email, shipping address)
Order is saved to backend with unique order ID and timestamp
Confirmation page displays order details and order number

file_operations.description: Create React Query mutation hook to submit checkout using the checkout backend method. Pass customer info as JSON string and handle the returned Order object or null response.

Create checkout form component using shadcn/ui Form components to collect customer name, email, and shipping address (street, city, state, postal code, country). Implement validation using react-hook-form with appropriate validation rules.
Create order summary component displaying all cart items with quantities, individual prices, subtotals, and grand total. Use shadcn/ui Table or Card components for layout.

Create checkout page that displays OrderSummary and CheckoutForm side-by-side or stacked on mobile. On form submission, call useCheckout hook with customer information JSON. On success, navigate to order confirmation page with order ID.

Create order confirmation page that receives order ID from navigation state and displays order number, timestamp, customer information, itemized order details, and total. Include success message and link to return to products page.
Wire the Checkout page at route '/checkout' and OrderConfirmation page at route '/order-confirmation/:orderId' into the app router.

requirements.summary: Design product display cards that integrate into the 3D environment with interactive elements
acceptanceCriteria: Products are displayed as 3D cards or objects within the Three.js scene
Product cards are interactive and respond to user input
Clicking a product opens detailed view or adds to cart
3D product displays maintain visual quality and performance

file_operations.description: Create 3D product card component using React Three Fiber that renders products as 3D cards or floating panels within the Three.js scene. Include product image as texture, use react-three/drei's Html component to overlay product name and price, and implement hover effects (scaling, rotation, glow) and click handlers that navigate to product detail or add to cart. Optimize geometry and textures for performance.

Create 3D product grid component that arranges multiple Product3DCard components in 3D space with proper spacing and layout. Implement smooth transitions when products load or filter state changes. Use instancing or other optimization techniques for rendering many products.
Integrate Product3DGrid into the Home page's 3D scene to showcase featured products within the immersive 3D environment. Fetch featured products using useProducts hook and pass to Product3DGrid.
Add option to view products in 3D mode using Product3DGrid alongside the traditional 2D ProductGrid. Implement view toggle button that switches between 2D and 3D product browsing experiences.

requirements.summary: Create cohesive visual design with modern professional aesthetic featuring deep teals, warm golds, and charcoal grays with elegant typography and premium layout emphasizing depth
acceptanceCriteria: Color scheme consistently uses deep teals, warm golds, and charcoal grays throughout the interface
Typography is clean and modern with appropriate hierarchy
Layout creates depth through layering, shadows, and visual separation
Overall aesthetic feels premium and professional

file_operations.description: Define CSS custom properties for the color palette: deep teal (#0D4F4F, #0A7B7B), warm gold (#D4AF37, #F4D03F), charcoal gray (#2C2C2C, #4A4A4A). Add typography styles using modern sans-serif font stacks with appropriate font weights (400, 500, 600, 700) and line heights. Define utility classes for shadows, depth layers, and transitions.

Extend Tailwind configuration to include custom color palette (deepTeal, warmGold, charcoalGray with multiple shades), custom font families, extended shadow utilities for depth effects, and custom spacing/sizing scales that support layered layouts. Configure theme to support premium visual aesthetics.

Create main layout component that wraps all pages with consistent structure including Navigation, footer, and appropriate spacing. Apply layering techniques with shadows and background gradients to create depth. Use the defined color palette throughout.
Wrap all routes with the Layout component to ensure consistent design and depth throughout the application.
